channel.title: [BATCH] Checking for a filetype and then taking action
channel.description:
This is my last question.
I tried google, best i found: http://www.computerhope.com/if.htm
didnt help.
currently: [code]IF EXISTS *.bat goto d[/code]
but it just opens and closes really fast (im not stupid pause is in there..)
whats wrong?

item.title: [BATCH] Checking for a filetype and then taking action
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“1337h4x, post:5, topic:140291”][quote author=lawl link=topic=192456.msg1733624#msg1733624 date=1188976405]
can you just fuck off with batch files already, THEY SUCK
[/quote]word[/quote]
I know they do, i just need it to check for something to determine wich file to run.

Read full topic

item.title: [BATCH] Checking for a filetype and then taking action
item.dc:creator: @remove_later remove_later
item.description:
@remove_later wrote:

if %%1 == *.dat (goto :runTheDat) else (goto :showTheError)

LOl I haven’t batch scripted in so long its such a shitty scripting language.
